goal.en: The primary goal of this course is to provide students a basic knowledge of human resource management
goal.ch: 本課程提供基礎與廣泛的介紹人力資源管理，以對組織中的員工有所了解。

content.en:
"Course Objectives:
‧ Obtain general knowledge of the research, theory, and application related to some of the major areas of Human Resource Management.
‧ Develop an understanding of the various approaches used in recruiting, selecting, staffing, training, appraising, and compensating employees.
‧ Explain, evaluate, and apply principle concepts and theories in major areas of Human Resource Management.
Tentative Schedule:
1 Course Introduction
2 Introduction to Human Resource Management
3 Strategic Human Resource Management
4 Job Analysis
5 Personnel Planning and Recruiting
6 Employee Testing and Selection
7 Interviewing Candidates
8 Training and Developing Employees
9 Mid-Term Exam
10 Performance Management and Appraisal
11 Establishing Strategic Pay Plans
12 Pay for Performance and Financial Incentives
13 Benefit and Services
14 Labor Relations and Collective Bargaining
15 Employee Safety and Health
16 Group Presentation #1
17 Group Presentation #2
18 Final Exam (non-cumulative)
Note. The instructor reserves the right to change the content of this syllabus."
